intro: Cachrys latiloba, commonly known as the broad-lobed tamarack, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the northeastern United States and southeastern Canada, typically found in moist, acidic soils in forested areas. The plant has needle-like leaves that are arranged in a spiral pattern along the stems. Its flowers are small, white, and clustered in inflorescences, blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant plays a role in ecological systems by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
